translated: Verses of the Elders
The Dvādasakanipāta
The First Chapter🔽Sīlavat’s Verses
One should train in virtue here,
well-trained in this world;
For virtue, when practiced,
brings all success.
The wise one should guard virtue,
aspiring to three kinds of happiness:
Praise, gain of wealth,
and rejoicing in heaven hereafter.
The virtuous one has many friends,
whom he gains through sympathy;
But the unvirtuous one, the doer of evil,
